companies.key_findings: Frontier Communications has not publicly announced a formal company-wide RTO policy. The company offers team-dependent and role-dependent flexibility, with some teams operating 100% virtually while others have different arrangements. Remote positions are common for customer-facing roles (customer service, technical support, sales). The company has received recognition for work-life balance, suggesting ongoing commitment to flexible work arrangements. No evidence of recent RTO mandate or policy tightening found.

policy_details.typical_schedule: 3 days per week in office for corporate employees in certain locations
policy_details.flexibility: Corporate employees required to spend 3 days each week at office locations. Previously had a 2-3 days per week policy announced in March 2022. The more recent internal communication increased the requirement to 3 days per week. Policy applies to corporate employees; pharmacy and retail staff continue on-site work.

companies.key_findings: CVS Health has implemented a hybrid work policy requiring corporate employees to work 3 days per week from office locations. This represents a tightening from the earlier 2-3 days per week policy announced in March 2022. The company sent internal communications about the 3-day requirement, though some details about specific locations and enforcement timelines were not publicly disclosed. CVS headquarters is in Woonsocket, Rhode Island, where it is one of the state's largest employers. The policy applies to corporate roles, while pharmacy and retail positions continue to be on-site.

companies.key_findings: Regions Financial has not made high-profile public announcements about their RTO policy, unlike larger national banks. Employee reviews suggest the company has transitioned from full remote work during the pandemic to some form of flexible or hybrid arrangement, with at least one employee indicating remote work options are being reduced. The specific number of required office days per week has not been publicly disclosed. The company is headquartered in Birmingham, Alabama, and operates as a regional bank across the Southeast.

policy_details.typical_schedule: 4 days per week in office for corporate employees
policy_details.flexibility: Strict 4-day in-office requirement announced alongside major organizational changes. Policy appears to be part of broader restructuring effort.

CarMax listed on Fortune 500 RTO tracker with recent policy changes

companies.key_findings: CarMax implemented a significant 4-day per week in-office requirement in November 2024. This announcement came during a period of major organizational change, including the termination of CEO Bill Nash (effective December 1, 2024), layoffs of hundreds of employees, declining stock price, and faltering earnings. The 4-day requirement represents a substantial reduction in remote work flexibility. The company is headquartered in Goochland, Virginia. The timing of the RTO mandate alongside leadership changes and layoffs suggests the policy is part of a broader restructuring strategy.

policy_details.flexibility: Company offers flexibility to work from home when necessary (feeling unwell, bad weather, vehicle breakdowns). BMC hires for full-time, hybrid to 100% remote positions.

companies.key_findings: BMC Software maintains a flexible hybrid work policy that allows employees significant autonomy in where they work. The company has not implemented strict RTO mandates and continues to hire for remote and hybrid positions. Employees report the ability to work from anywhere as long as they meet their work commitments, with additional flexibility for personal circumstances like illness or weather. This approach is consistent with many technology companies that have maintained more flexible work arrangements compared to other industries. No evidence of recent RTO tightening was found.

overall_trends.summary: Among these 5 companies (ranks 165-172 on Forbes 500), there is a mixed picture of RTO policies in 2024-2025. Two companies (CVS Health and CarMax) have tightened their policies, requiring 3 and 4 days in-office respectively. One company (Regions Financial) shows some evidence of tightening based on employee feedback. Two companies (Frontier Communications and BMC Software) maintain flexible, role-dependent approaches without strict mandates. The technology sector (BMC) continues to offer more flexibility than retail (CarMax) and healthcare (CVS). Financial services (Regions) appears to be following broader banking industry trends toward more in-office work.
